name: Kale Chips with Honey
author: Theresa Peters
summary: Slightly sweet but still crispy green goodness. Use raw agave in place of the honey if you wish.
ingredients: 2 bunches dino kale, cut into 2-inch pieces
directions: Combine the kale pieces, olive oil, lemon juice, and sea salt in a resealable bag
Seal and massage the mixture for 3 minutes
The kale will be starting to break down a bit
Drizzle the honey over the mixture and again massage gently for another 3 minutes; the kale will now be half the bulk you started with
Lay flat and even in a food dehydrator; cook at 115 degrees F (46 degrees C) until crispy, about 8 hours
Alternately, you can bake in an oven at 145 degrees F (65 degrees C) until crispy, 4 to 5 hours
